<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	This annual
	report on Form 40-F contains or incorporates by reference forward-looking
	statements relating to future events or future performance. In some cases,
	forward-looking statements can be identified by terminology such as &#147;may&#148;,
	&#147;will&#148;, &#147;should&#148;, &#147;expects&#148;, &#147;projects&#148;, &#147;plans&#148;, &#147;anticipates&#148; and similar
	expressions. These statements represent management&#146;s expectations or beliefs
	concerning, among other things, future operating results and various components
	thereof or the economic performance of the Registrant. Undue reliance should
	not be placed on these forward-looking statements which are based upon
	management&#146;s assumptions and are subject to known and unknown risks and
	uncertainties which may cause actual performance and financial results in
	future periods to differ materially from any projections of future performance
	or results expressed or implied by such forward-looking statements.
	Accordingly, readers are cautioned that events or circumstances could cause
	results to differ materially from those predicted. The Registrant undertakes no
	obligation to update publicly or revise any forward-looking statements
	contained herein and such statements are expressly qualified by the cautionary
	statement.
</FONT>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	DISCLOSURE REGARDING CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	A.
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of the end of the Registrant&#146;s fiscal year ended December 31, 2003,
	an evaluation of the effectiveness of the Registrant&#146;s &#147;disclosure controls and
	procedures&#148; (as such term is defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) of the
	Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;)) was carried
	out by the Registrant&#146;s principal executive officer and principal financial
	officer. Based upon that evaluation, the Registrant&#146;s principal executive
	officer and principal financial officer have concluded that as of the end of
	that fiscal year, the Registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures are
	effective to ensure that the information required to be disclosed by the
	Registrant in reports that it files or submits under the Exchange Act is
	recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified
	in Securities and Exchange Commission rules and forms.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	It should be noted that while the Registrant&#146;s principal executive
	officer and principal financial officer believe that the Registrant&#146;s
	disclosure controls and procedures provide a reasonable level of assurance that
	they are effective, they do not expect that the Registrant&#146;s disclosure
	controls and procedures or internal control over financial reporting will
	prevent all errors and fraud. A control system, no matter how well conceived or
	operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance that the
	objectives of the control system are met.&#160;
	Accordingly, the Registrant&#146;s control systems are designed to provide
	reasonable assurance that the Registrant achieves its desired control
	objectives and the Registrant&#146;s principal executive officer and principal
	financial officer have concluded that, as of the end of the fiscal year ended
	December 31, 2003, the Registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures are
	effective in achieving that level of reasonable assurance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	B.
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

</B>

<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During the fiscal year ended December 31, 2003, there were no changes
	in the Registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that has
	materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the
	Registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	AUDIT COMMITTEE FINANCIAL EXPERT
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The board of directors of EnerMark Inc., on behalf of the Registrant,
	has determined that Mr. Robert Normand, a member and the chairman of the
	Registrant&#146;s audit and risk management committee, is an &#147;audit committee
	financial expert&#148; (as such term is defined by the rules and regulations of the
	Securities and Exchange Commission) and is &#147;independent&#148; (as that term is
	defined by the New York Stock Exchange&#146;s listing standards applicable to the
	Registrant).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Securities and Exchange Commission has indicated that the
	designation of a person as an &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; does not
	impose on such person any duties, obligations or liability that are greater
	than the duties, obligations and liability imposed on such person as a member
	of the audit committee and the board of directors in the absence of such
	designation.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_CODE_OF_ETHICS>
<A NAME="FIS_CODE_OF_ETHICS"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CODE OF ETHICS
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During the fiscal year ended December 31, 2003, the Registrant adopted
	an amended &#147;code of ethics&#148; (as that term is defined by the rule and
	regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission), entitled the &#147;Code of
	Business Conduct&#148;, that applies to each director, officer (including its
	principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting
	officer or controller, or persons performing similar functions), employee and
	consultant of the Registrant. The Code of Business Conduct is available for
	viewing on the Registrant&#146;s website at www.enerplus.com under &#147;About Enerplus &#150;
	Corporate Governance&#148;. There were not any amendments to any provision of the
	Code of Business Conduct during the fiscal year ended December 31, 2003 that
	applied to the Registrant&#146;s principal executive officer,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	4

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="1" WIDTH="25%" NOSHADE COLOR="BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Audit fees were for
	professional services rendered by Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP for the audit of
	the Registrant&#146;s annual financial statements and reviews of the Registrant&#146;s
	quarterly financial statements, as well as services provided in connection with
	statutory and regulatory filings or engagements.
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Audit-related fees are for
	assurance and related services reasonably related to the performance of the
	audit or review of the Registrant&#146;s financial statements and not reported under
	&#147;Audit Fees&#148; above.&#160; No audit-related
	fees were incurred in the Registrant&#146;s last two fiscal years.
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Tax fees were for tax
	compliance, tax advice and tax planning.&#160;
	The fees were for services performed by the Registrant&#146;s auditors&#146; tax
	division except those tax services related to the audit.
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(4)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	All other fees are fees for
	products and services provided by the Registrant&#146;s auditors other than those
	described as audit fees, audit-related fees and tax fees. No such fees were
	incurred in the Registrant&#146;s last two fiscal years.
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(5)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Total audit fees billed by
	the Registrant&#146;s former auditors, Arthur Andersen LLP, during 2002 prior to
	their resignation as auditors of the Registrant effective June 3, 2002 were
	Cdn$27.9 for audit fees and Cdn$36.1 for tax fees.
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Registrant&#146;s audit and risk management committee has implemented a
	policy restricting the services that may be provided by the Registrant&#146;s
	auditors and the fees paid to the Registrant&#146;s auditors.&#160; Prior to the engagement of the Registrant&#146;s
	auditors to perform both audit and non-audit services, the audit and risk
	management committee pre-approves the provision of the services.&#160; In making their determination regarding
	non-audit services, the audit and risk management committee considers the
	compliance with the policy and the provision of non-audit services in the
	context of avoiding impact on auditor independence. All audit and non-audit
	fees paid to Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP in 2003 were pre-approved by the
	Registrant&#146;s audit and risk management committee. Based on the audit and risk
	management committee&#146;s discussions with management and the independent
	auditors, the committee is of the view that the provision of the non-audit
	services by Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP described above is compatible with
	maintaining that firm&#146;s independence from the Registrant.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_ACCOUNTANT_FEES>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_OFF_BALANCE_SHEET_ARRANGEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_OFF_BALANCE_SHEET_ARRANGEMENTS"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	OFF-BALANCE SHEET ARRANGEMENTS
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Registrant has no material off-balance sheet arrangements that have
	or are reasonably likely to have a current or future effect on the Registrant&#146;s
	financial condition, changes in financial condition, revenues or expenses,
	results of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures or capital resources
	that is material to investors.&#160; For a
	discussion of the Registrant&#146;s other off-balance sheet arrangements, please
	read Notes 10(b) and 10(d) to the Registrant&#146;s audited annual consolidated
	financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2003 included on page 92
	of the Registrant's 2003 Annual Report filed as Exhibit 1 to the Registrant&#146;s
	Report of Foreign Issuer on Form 6-K filed with the Securities and Exchange
	Commission on April 1, 2004, which notes are incorporated by reference herein.
</FONT>
</P>

	Additional disclosure regarding the Registrant&#146;s contractual
	obligations as of December 31, 2003 is provided under &#147;Commitments&#148; on page 67
	of the Registrant&#146;s Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis for the year ended
	December 31, 2003 filed as Exhibit 1 to the Registrant&#146;s Report of Foreign
	Issuer on Form 6-K filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on April 1,
	2004, which is incorporated by reference herein, and in Note 10 to the
	Registrant&#146;s audited annual consolidated financial statements for the year
	ended December 31, 2003 included on page 92 of the Registrant's 2003 Annual
	Report filed as Exhibit 1 to the Registrant&#146;s Report of Foreign Issuer on Form
	6-K filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on April 1, 2004, which
	note is incorporated by reference herein.

<EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDIT_COMMITTEE"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	IDENTIFICATION OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Registrant has a separately-designated standing audit committee
	established in accordance with section 3(a)(58)(A) of the Exchange Act. The
	members of the Registrant&#146;s audit and risk management committee are Robert
	Normand (as chairman), Harry B. Wheeler and Andr&#233; Bineau.&#160; Douglas R. Martin, the chairman of the board
	of directors of the Registrant, is an
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ex officio
</FONT>
</I>
	member of the audit and risk
	management committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMPLIANCE WITH NYSE CORPORATE GOVERNANCE RULES
</FONT>
</B>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Registrant
	has reviewed the New York Stock Exchange&#146;s corporate governance rules and
	confirms that the Registrant&#146;s corporate governance practices are not
	significantly nor materially different then those followed by domestic
	companies under the New York Stock Exchange&#146;s listing standards except that, as
	a foreign private issuer, the Registrant is not obligated to and does not have
	an internal audit function.&#160; The
	Registrant is currently reviewing its position on this matter.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNDERTAKING_AND_CONSENT>
<A NAME="FIS_UNDERTAKING_AND_CONSENT"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	UNDERTAKING AND CONSENT TO
	SERVICE OF PROCESS
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	A.
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Undertaking
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Registrant undertakes to make available, in person or by telephone,
	representatives to respond to inquiries made by the Commission staff, and to
	furnish promptly, when requested to do so by the Commission staff, information
	relating to: the securities registered pursuant to Form 40-F; the securities in
	relation to which the obligation to file an annual report on Form 40-F arises;
	or transactions in said securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	B.
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Consent to Service of Process
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The Registrant previously filed with the Commission a Form F-X in
	connection with the class of securities
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	in relation to which
	the obligation to file this report arises.
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2.

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Any change to the name or address of the Registrant&#146;s agent for
	service shall be communicated promptly to
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the Commission by amendment to Form
	F-X referencing the file number of the Registrant.

	&nbsp;

</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING:0PT;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;TEXT-SHADOW:NONE;">
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">

</FONT>
	Certification
	of the Chief Executive Officer pursuant to Rule 13a-14(a) or Rule 15d-14(a) of
	the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
</FONT>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_GLOSSARYOFTERMS">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	GLOSSARY
	OF TERMS
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Unless the context otherwise requires, in this Annual
	Information Form, the following terms and abbreviations have the meanings set
	forth below.&#160;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Additional terms relating to oil and
	natural gas reserves and operations have the meanings set forth under
	&#147;Presentation of Enerplus&#146; Oil and Gas Reserves and Production Information.&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#147;EGEM&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
	means Enerplus Global Energy Management
	Company, an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of the Fund which, prior to its
	acquisition by Enerplus from a third party, provided management and
	administrative services to Enerplus;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#147;EnerMark&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
	means EnerMark Inc., a corporation organized
	under the
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business
	Corporations Act
</FONT>
</I>
	(Alberta) and a wholly owned subsidiary of the
	Fund;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#147;Enerplus&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
	means Enerplus Resources Fund and its
	subsidiaries, taken as a whole;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#147;EOG&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
	means Enerplus Oil &amp; Gas Ltd., a
	corporation organized under the
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
</I>
	(Alberta) and a
	wholly owned subsidiary of ERC;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#147;ERC&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
	means Enerplus Resources Corporation, a
	corporation organized under the
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
</I>
	(Alberta) and a
	wholly owned subsidiary of EnerMark;
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#147;Fund&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
	means Enerplus Resources Fund;

	51-101

	&nbsp;

	&#147;Sproule
	Report&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
	means the independent engineering evaluations of
	Enerplus&#146; oil, NGLs and natural gas interests prepared by Sproule dated March
	19, 2004 and effective January 1, 2004, utilizing commodity price forecasts of
	Sproule dated January&nbsp;1, 2004;

	dated January 1, 2004 among EnerMark, ERC and the Trustee, as may be amended,

	representing an equal undivided beneficial interest in the Fund; and

	successor as trustee of the Fund.

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	barrels of oil equivalent converting 6 Mcf of
	natural gas to one barrel of oil equivalent and one barrel of natural gas
	liquids to one barrel of oil equivalent. The factor used to convert natural
	gas and natural gas liquids to oil equivalent is not based on either energy
	content or prices but is a commonly used industry benchmark.

</P>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=5,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=509232,FOLIO='IV',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_PRESENTATIONOFENERPLUSOILANDGASRE">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PRESENTATION
	OF ENERPLUS&#146;
<BR>
	OIL AND GAS RESERVES AND PRODUCTION INFORMATION
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Disclosure of Information
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	In this
	Annual Information Form, all estimates of oil and natural gas reserves and
	production are presented on a &#147;company interest&#148; (as defined below) basis,
	unless indicated that they have been presented on a &#147;gross&#148; or &#147;net&#148; basis.
	Enerplus&#146; actual oil and natural gas reserves and future production will be
	greater than or less than the estimates provided in this Annual Information
	Form.&#160; The estimated future net revenue
	from the production of Enerplus&#146; oil and natural gas reserves do not represent
	the fair market value of Enerplus&#146; reserves.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The United States Securities and Exchange Commission
	(the &#147;SEC&#148;) generally permits oil and gas issuers, in their filings with the
	SEC, to disclose only proved reserves net of royalties and interests of others
	that an issuer has demonstrated by actual production or conclusive formation
	tests to be economically and legally producible under existing economic and
	operating conditions.&#160; Canadian
	securities laws permit oil and gas issuers, in their filings with Canadian
	securities regulators, to disclose not only Proved Reserves but also Probable
	Reserves (each as defined below), and to disclose reserves and production on a
	&#147;gross&#148; basis before deducting royalties.&#160;
	Probable Reserves are higher risk and are generally believed to be less
	likely to be accurately estimated or recovered than Proved Reserves. Enerplus
	has prepared this Annual Information Form in accordance with Canadian
	disclosure requirements, and as a result, Enerplus has disclosed reserves
	designated as &#147;Probable Reserves&#148; and &#147;Proved plus Probable Reserves.&#148;&#160; The SEC&#146;s guidelines strictly prohibit
	reserves in these categories from being included in filings with the SEC that
	are required to be prepared in accordance with U.S. disclosure
	requirements.&#160; Moreover, Enerplus has
	determined and disclosed estimated future net cash flow from its reserves using
	both constant and forecast prices and costs, whereas the SEC generally requires
	that prices and costs be held constant at levels in effect at the date of the
	reserve report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Although the Sproule Report is effective January 1,
	2004, Sproule has confirmed that the information contained in the Sproule
	Report would be identical if it were presented effective December 31, 2003, the
	fiscal year-end of the Fund. As a result, throughout this Annual Information
	Form, an effective date of December 31, 2003 has been utilized so that the
	effective date of Enerplus&#146; oil and gas reserves information coincides with the
	Fund&#146;s fiscal year-end as contemplated in NI 51-101.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Enerplus has adopted the standard of 6 Mcf:1 BOE when
	converting natural gas to BOEs.&#160; BOEs
	may be misleading, particularly if used in isolation.&#160; A BOE conversion ratio of 6 Mcf:1 BOE is based on an energy
	equivalency conversion method primarily applicable at the burner tip and does
	not represent a value equivalency at the wellhead.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note to Reader Regarding Oil and Gas
	Information and National Instrument 51-101
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The oil and gas operational and reserves information
	contained in this Annual Information Form contains the information required to
	be included in the Statement of Reserves Data and Other Oil and Gas Information
	pursuant to NI 51-101 adopted by the Canadian securities regulatory authorities
	and has been prepared and prescribed in accordance with Form 51-101F1.&#160; Readers should also refer to the Report on
	Reserves Data by Sproule Associates Limited attached hereto as Exhibit &#147;A&#148; and
	the Report of Management and Directors on Oil and Gas Disclosure attached
	hereto as Exhibit &#147;B&#148;.&#160; The effective
	date for the Statement of Reserves Data and Other Oil and Gas Information
	contained in this Annual Information Form is December 31, 2003 and the
	information contained in the Annual Information Form has been prepared as of
	April 22, 2004.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Certain of the following definitions and guidelines
	are contained in Section 5.4 of Volume 1 of the Canadian Oil and Gas Evaluation
	Handbook (First Edition, June 30, 2002) prepared jointly by The Society of
	Petroleum Evaluation Engineers (Calgary Chapter) and the Canadian Institute of
	Mining, Metallurgy &amp; Petroleum (Petroleum Society) (the &#147;COGE Handbook&#148;)
	and have been prepared by the Standing Committee on Reserves Definitions of the
	CIM (Petroleum Society).&#160; Readers should
	consult the COGE Handbook for additional explanation and guidance.&#160; Certain other terms used in this Annual
	Information Form have the meanings assigned to them in NI 51-101 and
	accompanying Companion Policy 51-101CP, adopted by the Canadian securities
	regulatory authorities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	v
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=6,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=63064,FOLIO='V',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Interests
	in Reserves, Production, Wells and Properties
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	company interest
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; means, in relation to
	Enerplus&#146; interest in production or reserves, its working interest (operating
	or non-operating) share before deduction of royalties and including any royalty
	interests of Enerplus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	gross
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; means:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	in
	relation to Enerplus&#146; interest in production or reserves, its working interest
	(operating or non-operating) share before deduction of royalties and without
	including any royalty interests of Enerplus;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	in relation
	to wells, the total number of wells in which Enerplus has an interest; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 43.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	in relation to
	properties, the total area of properties in which Enerplus has an interest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 43.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	net
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; means:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	in
	relation to Enerplus&#146; interest in production or reserves, its working interest
	(operating or non-operating) share after deduction of royalty obligations, plus
	Enerplus&#146; royalty interests in those production or reserves;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	in relation
	to Enerplus&#146; interest in wells, the number of wells obtained by aggregating
	Enerplus&#146; working interest in each of its gross wells; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	in relation to
	Enerplus&#146; interest in a property, the total area in which Enerplus has an
	interest multiplied by the working interest owned by Enerplus.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	working interest
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; means the percentage of
	undivided interest held by Enerplus in the oil and/or natural gas or mineral
	lease granted by the mineral owner, Crown or freehold, which interest gives
	Enerplus the right to &#147;work&#148; the property (lease) to explore for, develop,
	produce and market the leased substances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Reserves
	Categories
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Proved Reserves
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; are those reserves that
	can be estimated with a high degree of certainty to be recoverable.&#160; It is likely that the actual remaining
	quantities recovered will exceed the estimated Proved Reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Probable Reserves
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; are those additional
	reserves that are less certain to be recovered than Proved Reserves.&#160; It is equally likely that the actual
	remaining quantities recovered will be greater or less than the sum of the
	estimated Proved plus Probable Reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Possible Reserves
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; are those additional
	reserves that are less certain to be recovered than Probable Reserves.&#160; It is unlikely that the actual remaining
	quantities recovered will exceed the sum of the estimated Proved plus Probable
	plus Possible Reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Development
	and Production Status
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Each of the reserves categories (Proved, Probable and
	Possible) may be divided into developed and undeveloped categories:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Developed Reserves
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; are those reserves that
	are expected to be recovered from existing wells and installed facilities or,
	if facilities have not been installed, that would involve a low expenditure
	(for example, when compared to the cost of drilling a well) to put the reserves
	on production.&#160; The developed category
	may be subdivided into Producing and Non-Producing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	vi
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=7,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=130910,FOLIO='VI',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage15"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Developed
	Producing Reserves
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; are those reserves that are expected to be
	recovered from completion intervals open at the time of the estimate.&#160; These reserves may be currently producing
	or, if shut-in, they must have previously been on production, and the date of
	resumption of production must be known with reasonable certainty.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Developed
	Non-Producing Reserves
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; are those reserves that either have not been
	on production, or have previously been on production, but are shut-in, and the
	date of resumption of production is unknown.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Undeveloped Reserves
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; are those reserves
	expected to be recovered from known accumulations where a significant
	expenditure (for example, when compared to the cost of drilling a well) is
	required to render them capable of production.&#160;
	They must fully meet the requirements of the reserves classification
	(Proved, Probable, Possible) to which they are assigned.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Levels
	of Certainty for Reported Reserves
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The qualitative certainty levels referred to in the
	definitions above are applicable to individual reserves entities (which refers
	to the lowest level at which reserves calculations are performed) and to
	reported reserves (which refers to the highest-level sum of individual entity
	estimates for which reserves estimates are presented).&#160; Reported reserves should target the
	following levels of certainty under a specific set of economic conditions:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	at
	least a 90 percent probability that the quantities actually recovered will
	equal or exceed the estimated Proved Reserves;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	at
	least a 50 percent probability that the quantities actually recovered will
	equal or exceed the sum of the estimated Proved plus Probable Reserves; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	at
	least a 10 percent probability that the quantities actually recovered will
	equal the sum of the estimated Proved plus Probable plus Possible Reserves.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Description of Price and Cost
	Assumptions
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Constant prices and costs
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148;
	means prices and costs used in an estimate that are:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Enerplus&#146;
	prices and costs as at December 31, 2003, held constant throughout the
	estimated lives of the properties to which the estimate applies; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	if, and only
	to the extent that, there are fixed or presently determinable future prices or
	costs to which Enerplus is legally bound by a contractual or other obligation
	to supply a physical product, including those for an extension period of a
	contract that is likely to be extended, those prices or costs rather than the
	prices or costs referred to in paragraph (i).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Forecast prices and costs
</FONT>
</B>
	&#148; means future
	prices and costs that are:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	generally
	accepted as being a reasonable outlook of the future; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	if, and only
	to the extent that, there are fixed or presently determinable future prices or
	costs to which Enerplus is legally bound by a contractual or other obligation
	to supply a physical product, including those for an extension period of a
	contract that is likely to be extended, those prices or costs rather than the
	prices or costs referred to in paragraph (i).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 45.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Calculation of Reserve Life Index
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;Reserve Life Index&#148; means the amount obtained by
	dividing the quantity of a particular category of reserves by Sproule&#146;s
	forecast of the first year&#146;s production for the corresponding reserve category.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	vii
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=8,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=910244,FOLIO='VII',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage16"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<H1 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_PRESENTATIONOFENERPLUSFINANCIALINFO">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;">
	PRESENTATION OF ENERPLUS&#146;
	FINANCIAL INFORMATION
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</H1>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	The
	financial information included and incorporated by reference in this Annual
	Information Form has been prepared in accordance with Canadian generally
	accepted accounting principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;)
</FONT>
</B>
	.
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
	Canadian
	GAAP differs in some significant respects from U.S. GAAP and therefore this
	financial information may not be comparable to the financial information of
	U.S. companies.&#160; The principal
	differences as they apply to the Fund are summarized in Note 12 to the Fund&#146;s
	audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2003.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In this Annual Information Form, unless otherwise
	indicated, all dollar amounts are in Canadian dollars and all references to &#147;$&#148;
	are to Canadian dollars.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H1 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_DESCRIPTIONOFDISTRIBUTABLEINCOME">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;">
	DESCRIPTION OF DISTRIBUTABLE
	INCOME
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</H1>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Throughout this Annual Information Form, Enerplus uses
	the term &#147;distributable income&#148; to refer to the amount of cash that has been or
	is to be available for distribution to the Fund&#146;s unitholders.&#160; &#147;Distributable income&#148; is not a measure
	recognized by Canadian generally accepted accounting principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;) and
	does not have a standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP, but is an amount
	calculated in accordance with the terms of the Fund&#146;s Trust Indenture.&#160; Therefore, distributable income of the Fund
	may not be comparable to similar measures presented by other issuers, and
	investors are cautioned that distributable income should not be construed as an
	alternative to net earnings, cash flow from operating activities or other
	measures of financial performance calculated in accordance with GAAP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_FORWARD_LOOK>
<A NAME="FIS_FORWARD_LOOK_2"></A>
<H1 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_FORWARDLOOKINGSTATEMENTS">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;">
	FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</H1>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	This Annual Information Form contains forward-looking
	statements which are based on Enerplus&#146; current internal expectations,
	estimates, projections, assumptions and beliefs.&#160; Forward-looking statements are made by Enerplus in light of its
	experience and its perception of historical trends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	All statements that address expectations or
	projections about the future, including statements about Enerplus&#146; strategy for
	growth, expected future expenditures, commodity prices, costs, schedules,
	production volumes, operating and financial results and expected impact of
	future contractual commitments, are forward-looking statements.&#160; Some of the forward-looking statements may
	be identified by words such as &#147;expects&#148;, &#147;anticipates&#148;, &#147;believes&#148;,
	&#147;projects&#148;, &#147;plans&#148; and similar expressions. These statements are not
	guarantees of future performance and involve a number of risks and
	uncertainties. Such forward-looking statements necessarily involve known and
	unknown risks and uncertainties, which may cause Enerplus&#146; actual performance
	and financial results in future periods to differ materially from any
	projections of future performance or results expressed or implied by such
	forward-looking statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	These risks and uncertainties include, among other
	things, changes in general economic, market and business conditions; changes or
	fluctuations in production levels, commodity prices, currency exchange rates,
	capital expenditures, reserves or reserves estimates and debt service
	requirements; changes to legislation, investment eligibility or investment
	criteria; Enerplus&#146; ability to comply with current and future environmental or
	other laws; Enerplus&#146; success at acquisition, exploitation and development of
	reserves; actions by governmental or regulatory authorities including
	increasing taxes, changes in investment or other regulations; and the
	occurrence of unexpected events involved in the operation and development of
	oil and gas properties.&#160; The foregoing
	factors are not exhaustive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Many of these risk
	factors and other specific risks and uncertainties are discussed in further
	detail throughout this Annual Information Form and in Enerplus&#146; Management&#146;s
	Discussion and Analysis, incorporated by reference herein. &#160;Readers are also referred to the risk factors
	described in this Annual Information Form and in other documents Enerplus files
	from time to time with securities regulatory authorities.&#160; Copies of these documents are available
	without charge from Enerplus. &#160;Enerplus
	disclaims any responsibility to update these forward-looking statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	viii
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ENERPLUS
	RESOURCES FUND
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Renewal
	Annual Information Form
<BR>
	For the year ended December 31, 2003
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H1 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_STRUCTUREOFENERPLUSRESOURCESFUND">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;">
	STRUCTURE OF ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</H1>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H3 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Enerplus
	Resources Fund
</FONT>
</B>
</H3>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Enerplus Resources Fund is an energy investment trust
	created in 1986 under the laws of the Province of Alberta pursuant to the Trust
	Indenture.&#160; The Fund&#146;s assets currently
	consist of the securities of several direct and indirect operating subsidiaries
	(the primary of which are EnerMark, ERC and EOG), an unsecured note issued by
	EnerMark to the Fund and 95%, 99% and 99% royalties on the crude oil and
	natural gas property interests of EnerMark, ERC and EOG, respectively.&#160; The head, principal and registered office of
	Enerplus is located at The Dome Tower, Suite 3000, 333 - 7
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	Avenue
	S.W., Calgary, Alberta, T2P 2Z1.&#160; The
	Trustee of the Fund is CIBC Mellon Trust Company located at 600 The Dome Tower,
	333 &#150; 7
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	Avenue S.W., Calgary, Alberta T2P 2Z1.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Fund&#146;s primary focus is to maintain and enhance
	cash distributions to its unitholders through the development of its operating
	subsidiaries&#146; existing crude oil and natural gas properties, the acquisition of
	new producing properties and the monetization, by the way of sale or farm out,
	of its operating subsidiaries&#146; higher risk exploration opportunities.&#160; Development efforts are concentrated on
	optimizing production from existing and new crude oil and natural gas reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H3 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	EnerMark Inc.,
	Enerplus Resources Corporation and Enerplus Oil &amp; Gas Ltd.
</FONT>
</B>
</H3>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Each of EnerMark, ERC and EOG are corporations
	organized under the
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
</I>
	(Alberta).&#160; All of the issued and outstanding common
	shares of EnerMark are owned by the Fund, all of the issued and outstanding
	common shares of ERC are owned by EnerMark and all of the issued and
	outstanding common shares of EOG are owned by ERC.
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
	The board of directors of EnerMark is responsible for the
	governance of Enerplus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	EnerMark, ERC and EOG, together with the Fund&#146;s other
	direct and indirect operating subsidiaries, acquire, exploit and operate crude
	oil and natural gas assets in western Canada for the benefit of the Fund.&#160; See &#147;Operational Information&#148; and &#147;Oil and
	Natural Gas Reserves&#148; for information regarding the operations and oil and
	natural gas reserves of Enerplus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Organization
	Chart
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The simplified organizational structure of Enerplus,
	including the material subsidiaries of the Fund and the flows of cash from
	EnerMark, ERC and EOG to the Fund and from the Fund to its unitholders, is set
	forth below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<IMG BORDER="0" WIDTH="576" HEIGHT="783" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2004/04/22/0001047469-04-013073_EX1IMAGE004.GIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
