</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	that it has not faced in the past.&#160; If Enerplus does not manage these challenges
	and risks successfully, its results of operations and financial condition could
	be adversely affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Delays in business operations could adversely
	affect the Fund&#146;s distributions to unitholders.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In addition to the usual delays in payment by
	purchasers of oil and natural gas to the operators of Enerplus&#146; properties, and
	the delays of those operators in remitting payment to Enerplus, payments
	between any of these parties may also be delayed by:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	restrictions
	imposed by lenders;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	accounting
	delays;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	delays in the
	sale or delivery of products;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	delays in the
	connection wells to a gathering system;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	blowouts or
	other accidents;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	adjustments
	for prior periods;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	recovery by
	the operator of expenses incurred in the operation of the properties; or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the
	establishment by the operator of reserves for these expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Any of these delays could reduce the amount of cash
	available for distribution to Enerplus&#146; unitholders in a given period and
	expose Enerplus to additional third party credit risks.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The industry in which Enerplus operates exposes
	Enerplus to potential liabilities that may not be covered by insurance.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Enerplus&#146; operations are subject to all of the risks
	normally associated with the operation and development of oil and natural gas
	properties, including the drilling of oil and natural gas wells and the
	production and transportation of oil and natural gas.&#160; These risks and hazards include encountering unexpected
	formations or pressures, blow-outs, craterings and fires, all of which could
	result in personal injury, loss of life or environmental and other damage to
	Enerplus&#146; property and the property of others.&#160;
	Enerplus cannot fully protect against all of these risks, nor are all of
	these risks insurable.&#160; Enerplus may
	become liable for damages arising from these events against which it cannot
	insure or against which it may elect not to insure because of high premium
	costs or other reasons.&#160; While Enerplus
	has both safety and environmental policies in place to protect its operators
	and employees and to meet regulatory requirements in areas where they operate,
	any costs incurred to repair damages or pay liabilities would reduce funds
	available for distribution to the Fund&#146;s unitholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The loss of Enerplus&#146; key management and other
	personnel could impact its business.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Unitholders are entirely dependent on the management
	of Enerplus with respect to the acquisition of oil and natural gas properties
	and assets, the development and acquisition of additional reserves, the
	management and administration of all matters relating to Enerplus&#146; properties
	and the administration of the Fund.&#160; The
	loss of the services of key individuals could have a detrimental effect on the
	Fund.&#160; Investors should carefully
	consider whether they are willing to rely on the management of Enerplus before
	investing in the Trust Units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	46
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=55,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=50207,FOLIO='46',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage63"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Conflicts of interest may arise between Enerplus
	and its directors and officers.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Circumstances may arise where directors and officers
	of Enerplus are directors or officers of corporations or other entities
	involved in the oil and gas industry which are in competition to the interests
	of Enerplus.&#160; No assurances can be given
	that opportunities identified by such persons will be provided to Enerplus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Lower oil and gas
	prices increase the risk of write-downs of Enerplus&#146; oil and gas property
	investments
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	.
</FONT>
</H3>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under Canadian accounting rules, the net capitalized
	cost of oil and gas properties may not exceed a &#147;ceiling limit&#148; that is based,
	in part, upon estimated future net cash flows from reserves.&#160; If the net capitalized costs exceed this limit,
	Enerplus must charge the amount of the excess against earnings.&#160; If oil and natural gas prices decline,
	Enerplus&#146; net capitalized cost may exceed this cost ceiling, ultimately
	resulting in a charge against its earnings.&#160;
	Under United States generally accepted accounting principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;),
	the cost ceiling is generally lower than under Canadian GAAP because the future
	net cash flows used in the United States ceiling test are discounted to a
	present value.&#160; Accordingly, Enerplus
	would have more risk of a ceiling test write-down in a declining price
	environment if Enerplus reported under United States GAAP.&#160; While these write-downs would not affect
	cash flow, the charge to earnings could be viewed unfavourably in the market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Unforeseen title defects may result in a loss of
	entitlement to production and reserves.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	From time to time, Enerplus conducts title reviews in
	accordance with industry practice prior to purchases of resource assets.
	However, if conducted, these reviews do not guarantee that an unforeseen defect
	in the chain of title will not arise and defeat Enerplus&#146; title to the
	purchased assets.&#160; If this type of
	defect were to occur, Enerplus&#146; entitlement to the production and reserves from
	the purchased assets could be jeopardized and, as a result, distributions to
	unitholders may be reduced.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risks Related to Enerplus&#146; Structure and the Ownership of the
	Trust Units
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Changes in tax and other laws may adversely
	affect unitholders.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Income tax laws, or other laws or government incentive
	programs relating to the oil and gas industry, such as the treatment of mutual
	fund trusts and resource allowance, may in the future be changed or interpreted
	in a manner that adversely affects the Fund and its unitholders. For instance,
	certain proposed amendments to the Tax Act announced in the Canadian federal
	government&#146;s 2004 budget may affect the permitted amount of non-Canadian
	resident ownership of the Trust Units and may result in increased withholding
	tax on the Fund&#146;s cash distributions paid to non-residents of Canada. See
	&#147;General Development of Enerplus Resources Fund &#150; Recent Developments &#150;
	Non-Resident Ownership, Mutual Fund Trust Status and Impact of 2004 Canadian
	Federal Government Budget Proposals&#148;. In particular, the proposed transition
	period within which Enerplus may be required to take certain steps to ensure
	that it &#147;not be maintained primarily for the benefit of non-residents&#148; of
	Canada (as defined in the Tax Act), currently proposed to end on January 1,
	2007, may be shortened or eliminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Whether or not the transition period is shortened or
	eliminated, Enerplus may not be able to take steps necessary to ensure that the
	Fund &#147;not be maintained primarily for the benefits of non-residents&#148; within the
	prescribed transition period, if any, and to ensure that the Fund maintains its
	mutual fund trust status (as further discussed below). Even if the Fund is
	successful in taking such measures, there can be no assurance that such
	measures will be completed in a manner that is not detrimental to unitholders,
	including both non-resident unitholders and the unitholders as a whole.
	Additionally, legislation may be implemented to limit the investment in income
	funds and royalty trusts by certain investors or to change the manner in which
	these entities are taxed. Tax authorities having jurisdiction over Enerplus or
	the unitholders may disagree with how Enerplus calculates its income for tax
	purposes or could change administrative practices to Enerplus&#146; detriment or the
	detriment of its unitholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	47
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=56,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=305691,FOLIO='47',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	There would be material adverse tax consequences
	if the Fund lost its status as a mutual fund trust under Canadian tax laws.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Enerplus intends that the Fund will continue to
	qualify as a mutual fund trust for purposes of the Tax Act.&#160; The Fund may not, however, always be able to
	satisfy any future requirements for the maintenance of mutual fund trust
	status.&#160; See &#147;&#150; Changes in tax and other
	laws may adversely affect unitholders&#148; above and &#147;General Development of Enerplus
	Resources Fund &#150; Recent Developments &#150; Non-Resident Ownership, Mutual Fund
	Trust Status and Impact of 2004 Canadian Federal Government Budget
	Proposals&#148;.&#160; Should the status of the
	Fund as a mutual fund trust be lost or successfully challenged by a relevant
	tax authority, certain adverse consequences may arise for the Fund and its
	unitholders. Some of the significant consequences of losing mutual fund trust
	status are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The
	Fund would be taxed on certain types of income distributed to unitholders,
	including income generated by the royalties held by the Fund. Payment of this
	tax may have adverse consequences for some unitholders, particularly
	unitholders that are not residents of Canada and residents of Canada that are
	otherwise exempt from Canadian income tax.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The
	Fund would cease to be eligible for the capital gains refund mechanism
	available under Canadian tax laws if it ceased to be a mutual fund trust.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Trust
	Units held by unitholders that are not residents of Canada would become taxable
	Canadian property.&#160; These non-resident
	holders would be subject to Canadian income tax on any gains realized on a
	disposition of Trust Units held by them.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Trust
	Units would not constitute qualified investments for registered retirement
	savings plans (&#147;RRSPs&#148;), registered retirement income funds (&#147;RRIFs&#148;),
	registered education savings plans (&#147;RESPs&#148;) or deferred profit sharing plans
	(&#147;DPSPs&#148;).&#160; If, at the end of any month,
	one of these exempt plans holds Trust Units that are not qualified investments,
	the plan must pay a tax equal to 1% of the fair market value of the Trust Units
	at the time the Trust Units were acquired by the exempt plan.&#160; An RRSP or RRIF holding non-qualified Trust
	Units would be subject to taxation on income attributable to the Trust
	Units.&#160; If an RESP holds non-qualified
	Trust Units, it may have its registration revoked by the Canada Customs and
	Revenue Agency.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
	&#149;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The
	Fund would no longer be exempt from the application of the alternative minimum
	tax provisions of the Tax Act.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In addition, Enerplus may take certain measures in the
	future to the extent it believes necessary to ensure that the Fund maintains
	its status as a mutual fund trust.&#160;
	These measures could be adverse to certain holders of Trust Units,
	particularly &#147;non-residents&#148; of Canada (as defined in the Tax Act).&#160; See &#147;Description of the Trust Units and the
	Trust Indenture &#150;&#160; Non-Resident
	Ownership Provisions.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The rights of an Enerplus unitholder differ from
	those associated with other types of investments.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Trust Units do not represent a traditional
	investment in the oil and natural gas sector and should not be viewed by
	investors as shares in Enerplus.&#160; The
	Trust Units represent an equal fractional beneficial interest in the Fund and,
	as such, the ownership of the Trust Units does not provide unitholders with the
	statutory rights normally associated with ownership of shares of a corporation,
	including, for example, the right to bring &#147;oppression&#148; or &#147;derivative&#148;
	actions.&#160; The unavailability of these
	statutory rights may also reduce the ability of the Fund&#146;s unitholders to seek
	legal remedies against other parties on Enerplus&#146; behalf.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Trust Units are also unlike conventional debt
	instruments in that there is no principal amount owing directly to
	unitholders.&#160; The Trust Units will have
	no value when reserves from Enerplus&#146; properties can no longer be economically
	produced or marketed.&#160; Unitholders will
	only be able to obtain a return of the capital they invested during the period
	when reserves may be economically recovered and sold.&#160; Accordingly, the distributions unitholders receive over the life
	of an investment may not meet or exceed the initial capital investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	48
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=57,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=195993,FOLIO='48',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Changes in market-based factors may adversely
	affect the trading price of the Trust Units.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The market price of the Trust Units is primarily a
	function of anticipated distributions to unitholders and the value of the
	properties owned by Enerplus.&#160; The
	market price of the Trust Units is therefore sensitive to a variety of market
	based factors including, but not limited to, interest rates and the
	comparability of the Fund&#146;s Trust Units to other yield-oriented
	securities.&#160; Any changes in these
	market-based factors may adversely affect the trading price of the Trust Units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The limited liability of the Fund&#146;s unitholders
	is uncertain.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Because of uncertainties in the law relating to
	investment trusts, there is a risk that a unitholder could be held personally
	liable for obligations of the Fund in respect of contracts or undertakings
	which the Fund enters into and for certain liabilities arising otherwise than
	out of contracts including claims in tort, claims for taxes and possibly
	certain other statutory liabilities.&#160;
	Although it is intended that every written contract or commitment of the
	Fund will contain an express disavowal of liability of the unitholders and a
	limitation of liability to Fund property, such protective provisions may not
	operate to avoid unitholder liability.&#160;
	Notwithstanding Enerplus&#146; attempts to limit unitholder liability,
	unitholders may not be protected from liabilities of the Fund to the same
	extent that a shareholder is protected from the liabilities of a
	corporation.&#160; Further, although the Fund
	has agreed to indemnify and hold harmless each unitholder from any costs,
	damages, liabilities, expenses, charges and losses suffered by a unitholder
	resulting from or arising out of the unitholder not having limited liability,
	Enerplus cannot assure prospective investors that any assets would be available
	in these circumstances to reimburse unitholders for any such liability.&#160; However, personal liability to unitholders
	of a trust in Canada is minimal where the beneficiaries are not controlling the
	day-to-day activities of the trust and there is no direct contact between the
	beneficiaries of the trust and parties who contract with the trust, each of
	which conditions is satisfied in the case of the Fund and its unitholders.
	Legislation that would limit trust unitholder liability has been proposed or
	discussed in certain jurisdictions of Canada but such legislation has not yet
	been passed and there is no assurance that such legislation will be passed in
	any jurisdiction or be enacted in a manner that will eliminate all risk of
	unitholder liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The redemption rights of unitholders is limited.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Unitholders have a limited right to require the Fund
	to repurchase Trust Units, which is referred to as a redemption right.&#160; See &#147;Description of the Trust Units and the
	Trust Indenture - Redemption Right&#148;.&#160; It
	is anticipated that the redemption right will not be the primary mechanism for
	unitholders to liquidate their investment.&#160;
	The Fund&#146;s ability to pay cash in connection with a redemption is
	subject to limitations.&#160; Any securities
	which may be distributed in specie to unitholders in connection with a
	redemption may not be listed on any stock exchange and a market may not develop
	for such securities.&#160; In addition, there
	may be resale restrictions imposed by law upon the recipients of the securities
	pursuant to the redemption right.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	49
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=58,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=556806,FOLIO='49',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risks
	Particular to United States and Other Non-Resident Unitholders
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In addition to the risk factors set forth above (and
	in particular those set forth under &#147;Risks Related to Enerplus&#146; Structure and
	the Ownership of the Trust Units &#150; Changes in tax and other laws may adversely
	affect unitholders&#148;), the following risk factors are particular to unitholders
	who are not residents of Canada.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	United States unitholders may be subject to
	passive foreign investment company rules.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Fund may be a passive foreign investment company
	for United States federal income tax purposes for the 2004 taxable year and in
	subsequent taxable years.&#160; However,
	Enerplus has received advice that the Fund should not be considered a passive
	foreign investment company for the years 2002 and 2003.&#160; If the Fund were classified as a passive
	foreign investment company, United States unitholders (other than most tax-exempt
	investors) would be subject to adverse tax rules.&#160; Under these adverse tax rules, United States unitholders
	generally would be required to allocate any gain or any excess distributions,
	which include any annual distributions other than in the first year the
	unitholder held Trust Units, that is greater than 125% of the average annual
	distributions received by that unitholder in the three preceding taxable years
	or, if shorter, that unitholder&#146;s holding period for Trust Units.&#160; The amount allocated to the current taxable
	year and any year prior to the first year in which Enerplus was a passive
	foreign investment company would be taxed as ordinary income in the current
	year.&#160; The amount allocated to each of
	the other taxable years would be subject to tax at the highest rate of tax in
	effect for the applicable class of taxpayer for that year, and an interest
	charge for the deemed deferral benefit would be imposed with respect to the
	resulting tax attributable to each of the other taxable years.&#160; Holders will not be able to make a
	&#147;qualified electing fund&#148; election or, with respect to the Fund&#146;s operating
	subsidiaries that were considered to be passive foreign investment companies, a
	&#147;mark-to-market&#148; election to protect themselves from these potential adverse
	consequences if Enerplus were ultimately determined to be a passive foreign
	investment company.&#160; United States
	unitholders are strongly urged to consult their own tax advisors regarding the
	United States federal income tax consequences of Enerplus&#146; possible
	classification as a passive foreign investment company and the consequences of
	such classification.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	United States and other non-resident unitholders
	may be subject to additional taxation.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Canadian Tax Act and the tax treaties between
	Canada and other countries may impose additional withholding or other taxes on
	the cash distributions or other property paid by the Fund to unitholders who
	are not residents of Canada, and these taxes may change from time to time. In
	particular, a proposal contained in the Canadian federal government&#146;s 2004 budget
	would result in a 15% withholding tax being applied to return of capital
	portion of distributions made to non-resident unitholders after 2004. See
	&#147;Recent Developments &#150; Non-Resident Ownership, Mutual Fund Trust Status and
	Impact of 2004 Canadian Federal Government Budget Proposals&#148;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The ability of United States and other
	non-resident unitholders investors to enforce civil remedies may be limited.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Fund is a trust organized under the laws of
	Alberta, Canada, and Enerplus&#146; principal place of business is in Canada.&#160; Most of the directors and all of the
	officers of Enerplus are residents of Canada and most of the experts who
	provide services to Enerplus (such as its auditors and independent reserve
	engineers) are residents of Canada, and all or a substantial portion of their
	assets and Enerplus&#146; assets are located within Canada.&#160; As a result, it may be difficult for
	investors in the United States or other non-Canadian jurisdictions (a &#147;Foreign
	Jurisdiction&#148;) to effect service of process within such Foreign Jurisdiction
	upon such directors, officers and representatives of experts who are not
	residents of the Foreign Jurisdiction or to enforce against them judgments of
	courts of the applicable Foreign Jurisdiction based upon civil liability under
	the securities laws of such Foreign Jurisdiction, including United States
	federal securities laws or the securities laws of any state within the United
	States. In particular, there is doubt as to the enforceability in Canada
	against Enerplus or any of its directors, officers or representatives of
	experts who are not residents of the United States, in original actions or in
	actions for enforcement of judgments of United States courts of liabilities
	based solely upon the United States federal securities laws or the securities
	laws of any state within the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	50
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.61
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.16%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:12.94%;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3.28
</FONT>

<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<H1 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_MANAGEMENTSDISCUSSIONANDANALYSIS">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;">
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</H1>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	Management&#146;s discussion and analysis of financial
	results for the year ended December 31, 2003, as contained on pages 54 to 76 of
	the Fund&#146;s Annual Report for the year ended December 31, 2003, is incorporated
	by reference in this Annual Information Form.
</FONT>
</P>

	the Toronto Stock Exchange (the &#147;TSX&#148;) and the New York Stock Exchange (the
	&#147;NYSE&#148;).&#160; The trading symbol for the
	Trust Units on the TSX is &#147;ERF.UN&#148; and on the NYSE is &#147;ERF&#148;.

<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<H1 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_DIRECTORSANDOFFICERS">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;">
	DIRECTORS
	AND OFFICERS
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</H1>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H3 STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Directors of
	EnerMark
</FONT>
</B>
</H3>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The directors of EnerMark are nominated by the
	unitholders of the Fund at each annual meeting of unitholders.&#160; All directors serve until the next annual
	meeting or until a successor is elected or appointed.&#160; The name, municipality of residence, principal occupation for the
	past five years, year of appointment as a director of EnerMark and the number
	of Trust Units beneficially owned, directly or indirectly, or over which
	control or direction is exercised for each director of EnerMark are set forth
	below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Chairman of the board of
	directors and
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ex officio
</FONT>
</I>
	member of all committees of the board of
	directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The Audit and Risk
	Management Committee is comprised of Robert Normand as Chairman, Andr&#233; Bineau
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</B>
	and
	Harry B. Wheeler. Mr. Bineau
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</B>
	is not standing for re-election as a
	director of EnerMark at the 2004 annual general meeting and the resulting
	vacancy on this committee will be filled by the directors following that
	meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The Corporate
	Governance, Nominating and Environment, Health &amp; Safety Committee is
	comprised of Robert L. Zorich as Chairman, Derek J.M. Fortune and Andr&#233; Bineau.
	Mr. Bineauis not standing for re-election as a director of EnerMark at the
	2004 annual general meeting and the resulting vacancy on this committee will be
	filled by the directors following that meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(4)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The Compensation and
	Human Resources Committee is comprised of Douglas R. Martin as interim
	Chairman, Robert Normand and Derek J. M. Fortune.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(5)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The Reserves Committee
	is comprised of Harry B. Wheeler and Donald T. West.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(6)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Prior to the merger of
	Enerplus and EnerMark Income Fund on June 21, 2001, each of Derek J.M. Fortune
	and Robert Normand was a director of Enerplus Resources Corporation (&#147;ERC&#148;),
	the entity responsible for governance of Enerplus prior to the merger.&#160; Mr. Fortune was a director of ERC since June
	1992 and Mr. Normand was a director of ERC since March 1998.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(7)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	From 1991 to 2000, Mr. Martin was director of
	Coho Energy, Inc. (&#147;Coho&#148;), an oil and natural gas corporation that was listed
	on the TSE and NASDAQ.&#160; In 1999, Coho
	filed for protection under United States federal bankruptcy law, from which it
	was released in April, 2000.&#160; The
	directors of Coho were not held responsible for any actions.&#160; Mr. Martin resigned as a director of Coho in
	April of 2000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(8)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	In late 1997, Mr. Zorich
	was appointed to the board of directors of Benz Energy Inc. (&#147;Benz&#148;), a
	Vancouver Stock Exchange (now TSX Venture Exchange) listed company at the time,
	as a representative of Mr. Zorich&#146;s employer, EnCap Investments L.L.C., which
	had provided certain financing to Benz.&#160;
	On November 8, 2000, Benz, together with its wholly-owned subsidiary,
	Texstar Petroleum Inc., jointly filed a petition for protection under United
	States federal bankruptcy law, and on January 19, 2001, the shares of Benz were
	made subject to a cease trade order by the Alberta Securities Commission and
	suspended from trading on the Canadian Venture Exchange Inc. for failing to
	file required financial information.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(9)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Prior to the completion
	of the acquisition of EGEM by Enerplus on April 23, 2003, the executive
	services of Enerplus Resources Fund were provided by EGEM (and its predecessor,
	Enerplus Energy Services Ltd. (&#147;EES&#148;)), pursuant to a management
	agreement.&#160; All references to Enerplus in
	the above table prior to April 23, 2003 should be construed as references to
	EGEM or EES, but for simplicity, Enerplus has been utilized throughout the
	above table.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Officers of
	EnerMark

</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The name, municipality of residence, position held,
	principal occupation for the past five years, year of appointment as an officer
	of EnerMark and the number of Trust Units beneficially owned, directly or
	indirectly, or over which control or direction is exercised for each officer of
	EnerMark are set out below:

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Prior to the completion
	of the acquisition of EGEM by Enerplus on April 23, 2003, the executive
	services of Enerplus Resources Fund were provided by EGEM (and its predecessor,
	Enerplus Energy Services Ltd. (&#147;EES&#148;)), pursuant to a management
	agreement.&#160; All references to Enerplus
	in the above table prior to April 23, 2003 should be construed as references to
	EGEM or EES, but for simplicity, Enerplus has been utilized throughout the
	above table.&#160; Where an individual&#146;s
	principal occupation has been disclosed as being with EGEM, that individual
	undertook significant activities on behalf of EGEM other than the management of
	Enerplus Resources Fund.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of April 16, 2004, the directors and officers named
	above beneficially own, directly or indirectly, an aggregate of 371,350 Trust
	Units, representing approximately 0.4% of the outstanding Trust Units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Certain of the directors and officers named above may
	be directors or officers of issuers which are in competition with Enerplus, and
	as such may encounter conflicts of interests in the administration of their
	duties with respect to Enerplus.&#160; See
	&#147;Risk Factors - Potential Conflicts of Interest&#148;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

	OTHERS IN MATERIAL TRANSACTIONS

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	To the knowledge of the directors and executive
	officers of EnerMark, none of the directors or executive officers of EnerMark,
	or any associate or affiliate of the foregoing, has had any material interest,
	direct or indirect, in any material transaction with Enerplus since January 1,
	2001 or in any proposed transaction that would materially affect Enerplus.

	Sproule Associates Limited prepared the Sproule Report
	in respect of the Fund&#146;s oil and natural gas properties, a summary of which is
	contained in this Annual Information Form.&#160;
	The auditors of the Fund are Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP, Chartered
	Accountants, Calgary, Alberta.&#160; As of
	the date of the Sproule Report, the directors, officers and associates of
	Sproule, as a group, beneficially owned, directly or indirectly, less than 1%
	of the Fund&#146;s outstanding Trust Units at such time.&#160; As of March 5, 2004, the date of Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP&#146;s auditors
	report on the Fund&#146;s consolidated financial statements as at and for the year
	ended December 31, 2003, the partners of Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP, as a group,
	did not beneficially own, directly or indirectly, any Trust Units.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	To the board of directors of EnerMark Inc., on behalf
	of Enerplus Resources Fund (the &#147;Fund&#148;):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	We
	have evaluated and reviewed the Fund&#146;s reserves data as at January 1, 2004. The
	reserves data consist of the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	proved
	and proved plus probable oil and gas reserves estimated as at January 1, 2004
	using forecast prices and costs; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the
	related estimated future net revenue; and

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

	effective January 1, 2004, we confirm that the information contained in our

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We carried out our
	evaluation in accordance with standards set out in the Canadian Oil and Gas
	Evaluation Handbook (the &#147;COGE Handbook&#148;) prepared jointly by the Society of
	Petroleum Evaluation Engineers (Calgary Chapter) and the Canadian Institute of
	Mining, Metallurgy &amp; Petroleum (Petroleum Society).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Those
	standards require that we plan and perform an evaluation to obtain reasonable
	assurance as to whether the reserves data are free of material misstatement. An
	evaluation also includes assessing whether the reserves data are in accordance
	with principles and definitions presented in the COGE Handbook.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The
	following table sets forth the estimated future net revenue attributed to
	proved plus probable reserves, estimated using forecast prices and costs on a
	before tax basis and calculated using a discount rate of 10%, included in the
	reserves data of the Fund evaluated and reviewed by us as of January 1, 2004,
	and identifies the respective portions thereof that we have audited, evaluated
	and reviewed and reported on to the Fund&#146;s management and the board of
	directors of EnerMark Inc.:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="0%" VALIGN="TOP" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;BORDER:NONE;PADDING:0IN .7PT 0IN .7PT;WIDTH:.94%;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	A-1
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=66,EFW="2134324",CP="ENERPLUS RESOURCES FUND",DN="2",CHK=518970,FOLIO='A-1',FILE="DISK006:[04CLG2.04CLG1152.EDGAR]EX1_1152.CHC",USER="LSMITH",CD='APR 22 12:18 2004' -->
<A NAME="eolPage74"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	In our opinion, the reserves data
	evaluated by us have, in all material respects, been determined and are in
	accordance with the COGE Handbook. We express no opinion on the reserves data
	that we have reviewed but did not audit or evaluate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	6.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	We
	have no responsibility to update the report referred to in paragraph 4 for
	events and circumstances occurring after its preparation date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	7.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Because
	the reserves data are based on judgements regarding future events, actual
	results will vary and the variations may be material.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Executed as to our report
	referred to above:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	&nbsp;

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<A NAME="A2134324ZEX-1_HTM_APPENDIXB">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	APPENDIX
	&#147;B&#148;
</FONT>
</B>
</A>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	REPORT OF MANAGEMENT AND DIRECTORS
<BR>
	ON RESERVES DATA AND OTHER INFORMATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Terms
	to which a meaning is described in National Instrument 51-101 have the same
	meaning herein.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Management of EnerMark Inc. (&#147;EnerMark&#148;), on behalf of
	Enerplus Resources Fund (the &#147;Fund&#148;) are responsible for the preparation and
	disclosure of information with respect to the Fund&#146;s oil and gas activities in
	accordance with securities regulatory requirements. This information includes
	reserves data, which consist of the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	(i)
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	proved
	and proved plus probable oil and gas reserves estimated as at December 31, 2003
	using forecast prices and costs; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the
	related estimated future net revenue; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	(i)
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	proved
	oil and gas reserves estimated as at December 31, 2003 using constant prices
	and costs; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the
	related estimated future net revenue.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	An independent qualified reserves evaluator has
	evaluated and reviewed the Fund&#146;s reserves data. The report of the independent
	qualified reserves evaluator is presented as Appendix &#147;A&#148; to this Annual
	Information Form.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Reserves Committee of the board of directors of
	EnerMark has:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	reviewed
	EnerMark&#146;s procedures for providing information to the independent qualified
	reserves evaluator;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	met
	with the independent qualified reserves evaluator to determine whether any
	restrictions affected the ability of the independent qualified reserves
	evaluator to report without reservation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	reviewed
	the reserves data with management and the independent qualified reserves
	evaluator.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Reserves Committee of the board of directors of
	EnerMark has reviewed EnerMark&#146;s procedures for assembling and reporting other
	information associated with oil and gas activities and has reviewed that
	information with management. The board of directors of EnerMark has, on the
	recommendation of the Reserves Committee, approved:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the
	content and filing with securities regulatory authorities of the reserves data
	and other oil and gas information;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the
	filing of the report of the independent qualified reserves evaluator on the
	reserves data; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the
	content and filing of this report.
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	B-1
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<HR SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="GRAY" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Because the reserves data are based on judgements regarding future
	events, actual results will vary and the variations may be material.

<EFX_EXHIBIT_2>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_2"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'TIMES NEW ROMAN';">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EXHIBIT 2
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMMENTS BY AUDITORS
	FOR UNITED STATES READERS
<BR>
	ON DIFFERENCES BETWEEN CANADIAN AND UNITED STATES REPORTING STANDARDS
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In the United States of
	America, reporting standards for auditors also require the addition of an
	explanatory paragraph (following the opinion paragraph) outlining changes in
	accounting principles that have been implemented in the financial statements
	and/or when there are changes in accounting principles that have a material
	effect on comparability of Enerplus Resources Fund&#146;s financial statements. As
	discussed in Note 1 to the consolidated financial statements, the Fund changed
	its method of accounting for stock-based compensation to conform to the new
	Canadian Institute of Chartered Accountants Handbook recommendations Section 3870.&#160; Our report to the unitholders of the Fund
	dated March 5, 2004 is expressed in accordance with Canadian reporting
	standards, which do not require a reference to such changes in accounting
	principles in the auditors&#146; report when the changes are properly accounted for
	and adequately disclosed in the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&amp; Touche LLP
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="75%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:75.38%;">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
